node.title: Nation's largest live exporter has licence reinstated after four-year ban
node.alt: A pen with white walls is crowded full of sheep.
node.description: Live sheep exporter Emanuel Exports is given the green light to resume exporting animals from December 3, following a four-year ban.
node.content:
["Australia's largest live sheep exporter, Emanuel Exports, has had its licence reinstated after a four-year suspension.\u00a0", "The Perth-based company's licence was cancelled in 2018 after an investigation relating to the death of 2,400 sheep on a voyage to the Middle East while aboard the Awassi Express in 2017.", "The incident also led to a temporary ban on live sheep exports to the Middle East, and prompted an ongoing ban on exports during the northern hemisphere summer.", "On Monday, the Department of Agriculture, Water and Environment confirmed the company would be allowed to resume exports from\u00a0December 3, 2021.", "
'Sufficiently rehabilitated'
", "In a statement, the department said the company had\u00a0now \"sufficiently rehabilitated itself so as to resume its status as a body corporate of integrity\".\u00a0", "The department also said it had\u00a0since strengthened regulations by implementing a ban on export shipping to the Middle East during the hottest part of the northern hemisphere summer.\u00a0", "The department said it also required\u00a0heat stress management plans for northern summer voyages, lowered stocking densities for sheep on livestock export vessels, and required\u00a0automatic measurement and collection of on-deck temperature readings for voyages.\u00a0", "", "
Emanuel Exports was investigated\u00a0after video footage emerged showing almost 2,500 sheep either dead or dying aboard the Awassi Express in 2017.\u00a0(ABC News: Samantha Hawley )
", "
'Catastrophic failures'
", "WA Agriculture Minister Alannah MacTiernan said the Administrative Appeals Tribunal's (AAT) decision clearly documented conduct that contributed to the \"catastrophic failures\"\u00a0on the Awassi Express voyage.\u00a0", "", "
WA-based live sheep exporter Emanuel Exports has been given the green light to resume exports from Friday following a multi-year ban.\u00a0(ABC Rural: Kit Mochan)
", "\"The state's prosecution of Emanuel and two of its former directors for alleged acts of animal cruelty is ongoing.", "\"There remain important issues of applicability of state laws to resolve through this case.\"", "The RSPCA and Emmanuel Exports have been contacted for comment.\u00a0"]
